üíúThese are the main books that got me into reading (and writing). 

I have a few others that I loved as a pre-teen/teen, but these are the ones I still love to this day.

#yabooks #middlegradebooks #nostalgicbooks #nostalgicreads #bookstacklove #bookstack #booksonbooksonbooks #thehungergamestrilogy #thegiver #milkweedbook #identicalbook #suzannecollins #jerryspinelli #ellenhopkins #loislowry #teenreads

Identical by Ellen Hopkin
.
.
Warning ‚ö†Ô∏è this does have triggers of sexual abuse.
Background: This is a story about a teenage twin girls and how they are living with such disfunction in their home life and in themselves.
.
.
My Review: I figured schools are back in session I would use a review of one of the books I could not put down in high school. Ellen Hopkins was/is one of my all time favorite authors when I read her first book Crank and as many of her other books I could get my hands on. But once I read this book I was taken back. This is one of those dark and scary stories of what happens behind close doors and what teenagers are feeling when they are feeling lost and looking for their way out of a dark hole. I did not have the easiest or fun high school experience and I could relate to these girls very easily, but with the huge twist at the end it makes the story spin everything in your head. Also, Ellen Hopkins writes this story in poem format rather than a ‚Äúnormal‚Äù story layout. I do not recommend young kids or teens to read any of her books for their are very adult, but I do recommend older teens and young adults to read at least one of her books because they will change your life forever. 
.
.
#ellenhopkins #identicalbook #teenage #feelinglost #triggers #lifechanging #oneofmyfavorites

Book: Identical 
Author: @ellenhopkinsauthor 
Originally published: August 26,2008 
Genre: Young Adult Fiction 
Purchase at: @target @barnesandnoble @halfpricebooks Apple Books and Google play books. 
_____

Short Summary: ‚ÄúKaeleigh and Raeanne are identical down to the dimple. As daughters of a district court judge father and a politician mother, they are an all-American family‚Äî on the surface. But behind the facade, each sister has her own dark secret‚Äù

____

Review stars: 4/5 ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è
Review/thoughts: 
This book is so amazingly written and really shines a light on certain problems many young teens/adult face through their life at home and at school and within their own mind. Identical was the first book by Ellen Hopkins that I read and it blew me away. I drove myself up to @halfpricebooks to purchase two more of her books. Ellen Hopkins has written many more books and I‚Äôve made it a goal to read them all. The next one I‚Äôll be reading and reviewing is, Impulse. I hope you fall in love with Ellen Hopkins‚Äô work as much as I have! 
____

Wow!!üôåüòçüíØ It seems like the books I stumble across seem to be the best.  Like it's... FATE??ü§î (lol)
.
.
I thought it was a male author (even while adding it to my Wishlist on Amazon!), and ONLY caught my mistake because of this post.  I was SO impressed that a man would dare to take the female (teenage females at that!) point of view.  Regardless, Ellen Hopkins WENT THERE!! Yes.She.Did.üòÉ
.
.
And this is one that you'll WANT to read again. .
.
So, let the story build.  Stick with it.  Some of the content is shocking.  She doesn't linger there for too long, but it's also why I say she's daring to talk about the unspeakable...
.
.
